question: Is it ok for women to work outside home? I was reading a book on SINS and it said that a woman who must work to support family must work IN her home. Am I doing wrong by working outside my home.
answer:
QUESTION
.I do not work in a retail place. My job is a respectable office job involving social work but I do not meet the public. The people I come in contact with are my co-workers (80% women & 20% men). Is it sinful for to work at such a place? Please help. Jazakallah.
ANSWER


Share:
Respected Brother-in-Islam

Assalaamu Álaykum Wa Rahmatullaahi Wa Barakaatuhu

Kindly refer Hijaab at www.jamiat.org.za/isinfo/hijaab.html and 'When Women Emerge' at www.jamiat.org.za/isinfo/w_emerge.html

If you have no source of income and have to support yourself and your dependants, then you should try to confine your services to females only. If you are compelled to communicate with males then you will be excused. However, you should not be in isolation with any strange male. Rasulullah (Sallallaahu Alayhi Wasallam) said, 'When a strange male and female are in isolation, then third is Shaytaan.' Furthermore, when communicating with a male, lower your gaze and limit the discussion to the need. Free mixing and 'merry' discussion with strange males are prohibited.

And Allah Taãla Knows Best.

Was salaam

Mufti Ebrahim Desai
FATWA DEPT.
